attributes.action: British pet passports needed, valid in EU, as EU passports are valid in the UK
attributes.additional_details:
To Validate British pet passports in the EU the same way the EU passports are valid in the UK.  Scrap the animal health certificate which needs to be renewed each time we travel to Europe. 
Allow the British vets to fill the EU passports about the rabies vaccine, the same way the EU does that.
The Brexit bill should not be paid by the British citizens and residents
attributes.background:
Scrap the AHC. Not fair for UK citizens. In the EU the rules are still the same for the rest of Europe.  EU people do not need to pay any extra cost to bring their pets to the UK. 
The Brexit bill is paid by the British people. Lots of families can't afford to pay each time for AHC.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about existing arrangements for people to take their pets to the EU, but it's not clear exactly what changes you want to be made to existing arrangements.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Seek to rejoin the EU pet passport scheme: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/593806

If you want something different to the above petition you could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
